definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Highest level in the hierarchical Domain Name System of the Internet.
Future of Aviation Advisory Committee airport code.

A two alphabetic character code from the Geopolitical Entities and Codes (formerly FIPS 10-4 standard) that uniquely identifies a feature's primary geopolitical entity (countries, dependencies, and areas of special sovereignty).

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field can contain one, or multiple country codes to identify international (shared) features that run through multiple countries for up to 255 characters (example: Danube River - AU,BU,EZ…).

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A two alphabetic character code from the Geopolitical Entities and Codes (formerly FIPS 10-4 standard) that uniquely identifies the particular feature name that is applicable in a particular geopolitical entity, or entities, for international features.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field can contain one, or multiple country codes to identify international (shared) features that run through multiple countries for up to 255 characters (example: Danube River - AU,BU,EZ…).

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Scale range values to aid in the visualization and selection of features.

description.ISO:639:3:eng:
The display values correspond to the following scale ranges:

  • 1 – 1 - 25,999
  • 2 – 26,000 - 67,999
  • 3 – 68,000 - 150,999
  • 4 – 151,000 - 225,999
  • 5 – 226,000 - 325,999
  • 6 – 326,000 - 425,999
  • 7 – 426,000 - 625,999
  • 8 – 626,000 - 999,999
  • 9 – 1,000,000 or Smaller

example.ISO:639:3:eng:
A feature with display value of 1 should appear in a visualization client or service between scales of 1 and 25,999. It should not appear at scales of 26,000 and smaller.

A feature with display values of 1,2,3 should appear in a visualization client or service between scales of 1 through 150,999. It should not appear at scales of 160,000 and smaller.

A feature with display values of 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9 should appear in a visualization client or service at all scales.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: A numerical scale identifying the relative importance of a populated place. The scale ranges from 1 (high) to 5 (low). The scale can also include NULL (no value) as a value for populated places with unknown or undetermined relative importance.
This value indicates which transliteration system was used to arrive at the romanized equivalent of a non-Roman Script name.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value is computed by converting the Unique Feature Identifier into a string.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: International Air Transport Association airport code.
International Civil Aviation Organization airport code.
Three character ISO 639-2/B bibliographic language code.
Three character ISO 639-2/T terminological language code.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The date may omit the day or the month and day.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Geographic coordinates as an array of two elements, respectively the longitude and latitude in decimal degrees format.
Altitude interpolated from digital elevation model.
Geographic coordinates as an array of two elements, respectively the longitude and latitude in degrees, minutes and seconds format.
Countries, dependencies, and areas of special sovereignty.
P value of Chi squared for age ratio.
Digit preference score for mid-upper arm circumference.
Percentage of records with subjects out of range.
Value of kurtosis for weight for height Z-score.
P value that index of dispersion is not a Poisson distribution weight for height Z-score-2.
P value of Chi squared for sex ratio.
Value of skewness for weight for height Z-score.
Standard deviation of weight for height Z-score.
Method of sampling, a code e.g. cluster, random.
Number of subjects in the study.
Unique identifier for the object in the database.
Unique identifier for the object in the collection.
The version or revision of the current object.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value indicates the access status to the item, it provides information on who and how the item can be managed.
Generic attributes and qualifiers, is generally part of a structure and applies to the current element.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: List of branches passing through the current edge.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field contains the set of branches passing through the current edge. It is a set of the root nodes for all structures traversing the edge.

This field is used as a category, group or classification.

If provided in terms that define a controlled vocabulary, it will be used as the choice list for the branch state field in edge branch elements.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: When inserting new elements of an enumeration, this field is used to provide the choice list for the branch type field in edge branch structures. As the enumeration is traversed, the destination node is probed for this field, if it has it, the branch type field will be made available with the enumeration held in this field: the selected value will be the category of the source node.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Class that applies to the current item.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The class contains the required fields for the current item.

This field is stored in descriptors, it is managed by the system and automatically updated whenever a document is inserted and updated. It keeps track of all instances of the descriptor in the database and is structured as follows:

  • _collections: This is an array containing all the collections in which the descriptor is used. This property can be used to restrict the choice of descriptors when searching a specific collection.
  • _counts: This is an object where the the property name corresponds to a collection name and the value is the occurrence count of the current descriptor. This property can be used to provide the occurrence count when searching in a specific collection.

The property is managed by the system and it is reserved.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Collection to which the current item belongs.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: User defined objects are stored in collections that group objects by domain. In general, the domain and the collection are related, except that the collection should group objects with similar structures.

This field is stored in user defined descriptors, it is managed by the system and automatically updated whenever a document is inserted and updated. It keeps track of all instances of the descriptor in the database and is structured as follows:

{count: N, tree: {path: N}}

The count represents the total number of the descriptor instances.

The tree contains all distinct path instances.

The path represents all instances of the descriptor in any document with the full path to the descriptor expressed as the structure names separated by a ".". For instance, in the path a.b.c, "c" is the leaf and "a.b" is the path to that leaf. This value is used as the attribute name and the attribute value represents the count of descriptor instances using that particular path; the sum of all counts will be equal to the count value.

This field is only present in documents stored in user created collections.
Provide the number of decimals when displaying the number.
Provide the full definition for the object, this text should clearly explain what the object is. Such values will be used as tooltips that provide additional information to the labels.

example.ISO:639:3:eng:
For Mid-upper arm circumference:
`MUAC is the circumference of the left upper arm and is measured at the mid-point between the tips of the shoulder and elbow.`

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value indicates the implementation level at which the item was deployed.

Provide the full description of the object and the environment in which it is used. This explanation should convey how the object functions or, in the case of a measurement, the methods used to obtain it.

example.ISO:639:3:eng:
For Mid-upper arm circumference:

> To measure:
>
> 1. Bend the left arm, find and mark with a pen the olecranon process and acromium.
> 2. Mark the mid-point between these two marks.
> 3. With the arm hanging straight down, wrap a MUAC tape around the arm at the midpoint mark.
> 4. Measure to the nearest 1 mm.
>
> In children 6-59 month old, MUAC <110 mm indicates severe acute malnutrition and is recommended as …

description.ISO:639:3:eng:
This field is managed by the system and automatically updated whenever a document is inserted and replaced, it keeps track of all descriptors used in the document. It is a structure organised as follows:

  • _fields: This is an array containing all the leaf properties in the document. This property can be used to select all documents that have a specific descriptor, regardless of its position within the structure.
  • _paths: This is an array containing all the property paths in the document expressed in dot notation, a.b.c. This property can be used to select all documents that have a descriptor in a specific structure position.

The property is managed by the system and it is reserved.
Provide the domain to which the current item belongs.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Date in which the item was validated.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This is a reference to a field that is an element of a form, when set in a form field definition it indicates that if the form contains the non empty field referenced in this descriptor, the current field will be enabled; if the referenced field is missing or empty, the current field will be disabled.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This descriptor is generally used in class or form edges to indicate that the descriptor referenced by the edge should be enabled only if the field (descriptor) referenced by this descriptor is set. The reference is expressed as the gid of the referenced descriptor.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Provide a list of examples and explanations to to give a summary of the different forms in which the item can be found and provided.
This field contains a list of references to terms that define controlled vocabularies that contain descriptor elements, this set provides the valid list of choices for values of the field data type.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The elements of this controlled vocabulary are the gid field of the relative descriptors.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: The data format of the field.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value indicates the value format, it can be a scalar, a list or a set; this qualifier applies to the descriptor data type.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: If you define a descriptor with a string data type, by applying the scalar format, the value is expected to be a single string; by applying a list format, the value is expected to be an array of strings; by applying the set format, the value is expected to be a list of unique strings.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The user group to which the current user belongs.
This field contains a link to an internet resource that provides reference information about the current item.

This is a reference to a field that is an element of a form, when set in a form field definition it indicates that if the form field is empty, its value should be initialised from the value of the field referenced by this descriptor. If the form field has the protected status, this value cannot be modified.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This descriptor is generally used in class or form edges to indicate that the descriptor referenced by the edge should take the value from the field (descriptor) referenced by this descriptor. The reference is expressed as the gid of the referenced descriptor.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The instance associated with the current item.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This field contains the instance to which the current object refers to.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A data type term is an instance of a data type.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: All the contexts in which the current object has been instantiated in.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The instances list all instances in which the current object was used.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A data type term is an instance of a data type, but it is also instantiated as a controlled vocabulary element: the data type instance will be set in the instance field, while the data type and the enumeration element instances will be set in the instances list.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value indicates how the item is to be exchanged wit the system, as a read-only property, as a modifiable field or as a hidden value.
This field contains a string corresponding to the Joi validation commands sequence for the whole field.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The contents of this field are fed to the eval() function, so the caller must include the Joi JavaScript library. This field is set by the system.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Provide a short description that can be used to name the current object. This text should allow a human reader to identify the object in colloquial terms. Such values will be used as field labels in a form, or as descriptive labels in a table header.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: For Mid-upper arm circumference: `Mid-upper arm circumference`

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value indicates the default language in which the application elements will be displayed.
Provide the minimum and maximum length for the field. If not a scalar field, this setting applies to the elements of the list or set.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The size modifier indicates the range of elements when the list or set modifier is set, the length modifier indicates the range of characters, in case of a string, or the range of elements in case of types that implicitly represent lists or sets.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value indicates the hierarchy level of the item, it contains a numeric value that represents the level in the hierarchy. Lower values represent a higher importance level, this means that current attributes cannot be of a level with a lower value than the eventual inherited attribute.
The user or process that is the manager of the current user.
This field is a structure in which the key is the edge branch identifier, _id, and the value is a structure containing the modifier fields that apply to the specific branch.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: List of names in specific languages.
List of names with attributes and language.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Provide here general comments and annotations, this field can also be used to provide information about implementation details and instructions directed towards users that need to customise the system.

example.ISO:639:3:eng:
For Mid-upper arm circumference:
`MUAC is the circumference of the left upper arm and is measured at the mid-point between the tips of the shoulder and elbow.`

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value indicates the order of the item in a list, it contains a numeric value that represents the position in the list. Lower values will have a lower position.
Provide the minimum and maximum value that the value is allowed to take.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: To define a range where the *minimum* value must be *greater than zero* and the *maximum* value must *not exceed 99*: `0, 99, false, true`.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: Ranks belong to a controlled vocabulary organised in hierarchical levels determined by the level field. Lower level values correspond to higher hierarchical levels.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: A rank with level 2 will authorise ranks of level less than and including 2, but will forbid ranks with level higher than 2.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Regular expression used to validate input.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Provide a regular expression that the system can use for validating input values.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: To validate a *string* composed of *three digits* and *4 alphabetic lower string characters*: `[0-9]{3}[a-z]{4}`.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field contains a link to an internet resource that provides the schema or structure of the current item.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Shape or coordinates of the item.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field holds a GeoJSON structure that provides information about the geometry and geographic position of the current item.
Provide the minimum and maximum number of elements for lists and sets.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The size modifier indicates the range of elements when the list or set modifier is set, the length modifier indicates the range of characters, in case of a string, or the range of elements in case of types that implicitly represent lists or sets.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: The property may be contained the vertex, edge or in the edge branch. The _key value of the referenced descriptor will be used as the match. The precedence order is the branch, edge and vertex. The traversal property will be used to determine which vertex to choose: for inbound it will be the source node, for outbound it will be the destination node.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: This property can be set in two places: at the structure root node, in which case it will be inherited by all sibling edges; or in an edge, in which case it will be inherited by all the edge siblings.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This value indicates the status of the item, it provides information on the implementation component level and on the validation state.
Provide the storage type of the collection.

This is a reference to a set of fields, including the current one, that are elements of a form: when set in a form field definition and the current field is present and set, all the other fields contained in this switch list will be disabled.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: Date in which the item was terminated.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field contains a list of references to terms that define controlled vocabularies that contain term elements, this set provides the valid list of choices for values of the term data type.

note.ISO:639:3:eng: The elements of this controlled vocabulary are the _key field of the relative terms.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field contains the reference to the base data type of the descriptor.
This field contains a string that references a value cast function, this value is reserved to the system.
This field contains a string that references a custom validation function, this value is reserved to the system.

This field is used exclusively in the object type of key/value pairs: it defines the data type of keys; if omitted, the key is expected to be of text data type. The field is a structure containing the type field that defines the data type and an optional set of fields that add options to that data type.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: Using a type of term means that the structure keys must correspond to term key references.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: This field is used exclusively in the object type: it defines the data type of structure element values; if omitted, the values can be of any type. The field is a structure containing the type field that defines the data type and an optional set of fields that add options to that data type.

example.ISO:639:3:eng: This data type will be applied to all values of a structure.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Provide in which measurement unit the data should be expressed in by default. Values expressed in other units should be converted to this unit.

definition.ISO:639:3:eng: List of other units in which values can be expressed.

description.ISO:639:3:eng: Provide all the list of measurement units in which values of this type may be expressed in, excluding the standard unit. This field is used by the system to automatically convert provided values to the standard unit.
This value indicates the usage status, it provides information on the requirements and restrictions in using the item.

This field is a structure containing validation options, these are:

 
  • joi: A string containing the chain of Joi validation commands, these will be fed to eval() and will be used to validate the descriptor value.
  • type-cast: A string containing function name that will be used to cast the value.
  • type-custom: A string containing a function name that will be used to perform custom validation.
  • type-key: A structure containing the first three elements of this list relating to validation of object keys.
  • type-value: A structure containing the first three elements of this list relating to validation of object values.
